title: Embassy arranges repatriation of 4,000 stranded Pakistanis in Kabul
content:
ISLAMABAD, July 5 (APP): The Embassy of Pakistan in Kabul has made arrangements for repatriation of around 4,000 Pakistanis who had been stranded there owing to the closure of flights to Saudi Arabia.
The Pakistani citizens would be repatriated to Torkham, on special directives of Prime Minister Imran Khan to help the Pakistanis stranded abroad.
According to the embassy, the stranded Pakistanis were being provided decent accommodation at the embassy and provided food, transport and cash grant for their return to Torkham and onward travel to their respective home towns.
